intro: Stemodia grossa, commonly known as the roughstemmed stemodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with rough, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it blooms during the warmer months. Stemodia grossa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
